alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Clay; Randolph; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:46PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Randolph, northeastern Tallapoosa, northwestern Chambers and southeastern Clay Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 446 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ranburne to near Malone to near New Site. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Wedowee, New Site, Wadley, Woodland, Goldville, Malone, Abanda, Crystal Lake, Penton, Trammel Crossroads, Sparkling Springs, Daviston, Graham, Dickert, Newell, R.L. Harris Dam, Horseshoe Bend National Military Park, Napoleon and Tennant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
